title: South Korea authorities in standoff in bid to arrest President Yoon
byline: Authorities entered impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk’s compound on Friday to execute an unprecedented arrest warrant, evading a crowd of protesters outside, but were confronted with presidential security forces inside

title: Govt.’s new tax policy burdensome to people, harmful to economy
byline: United Republican Front (URF) leader Patali Champika Ranawaka said yesterday that the tax policy regime of the new government would burden people further and cause harm to the economy.

title: Govt. considers deporting Rohingya refugees at this point: Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala told the Daily Mirror that the government is considering on deporting Rohingya refugees who recently arrived in Mullaitivu after following the legal process and discussions.

title: Sri Lanka’s university system crippled with dearth of teachers
byline: Sri Lanka’s university system still remains crippled with a dearth of teachers, and the authorities concerned are struggling hard to find qualified persons to some of the positions fallen vacant at the moment, a minister said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka monitors virus outbreak in China
byline: In the wake of reports on a virus spreading in China, the Ministry of Health has announced that it is closely monitoring the situation.

title: Stringent measures in the offing for health sector donations
byline: Health Minister Nalinda Jayatissa announced that future donations to the health sector must align with the government’s national development plan.

title: Backlog of 130,000 driving license cards to be cleared by January
byline: Steps will be taken to print and issue the 130,000 accumulated driving license cards, delayed due to previous printing backlogs, within January.

title: Court extends freeze on Keheliya’s family accounts holding Rs. 93 Mn
byline: The Colombo High Court today further extended its order to freeze for three months 16 fixed deposit accounts and three insurance policies belonging to the family members of former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella.

title: Two arrested at BIA for smuggling cigarettes worth Rs. 50.9 million
byline: Two suspects were arrested at the Bandaranaike  International Airport (BIA) this morning by Police Narcotics Bureau personnel while smuggling in foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 50.9 million.

title: Wimal Weerawansa arrives at FCID
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) this morning to provide a statement regarding remarks he had made during a television programme on March 3, 2022.

title: Thalatha appointed UNP General Secretary
byline: Former President and UNP leader Ranil Wickremeisinghe has appointed Thalatha Athukorala as the new party General Secretary, party sources said.

title: Former PS member arrested following complaint by MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi
byline: A former Millaniya Pradeshiya Sabha (PS) member, Ravindra Nawamuni, has been arrested for sharing a post on social media that insulted National Peoples’ Power (NPP) MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi.

title: Yoshitha arrives at CID
byline: Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning to record a statement.

title: China faces Covid-like scare again
byline: China is experiencing a rise in respiratory illnesses, including human metapneumovirus (HMPV), according to reports. Reports and social media posts suggest the virus is spreading rapidly, with some claiming hospitals and crematories are overwhelmed. Videos online show crowded hospitals, with social media users highlighting the presence of multiple viruses, including influenza A, HMPV, Mycoplasma pneumoniae, and Covid-19.

title: ’Jean Aunty’, husband hospitalised after assault
byline: Social media activist ’Jean Aunty’ and her husband were attacked by two men last morning and are currently receiving treatment at the Ragama Teaching Hospital, confirmed hospital sources.

title: South Korea authorities in standoff in bid to arrest President Yoon
byline: Authorities entered impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk’s compound on Friday to execute an unprecedented arrest warrant, evading a crowd of protesters outside, but were confronted with presidential security forces inside

title: No threat from Indian Air Force training drone found in Trinco
byline: An investigation into the recovery of an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) in Sri Lankan waters, believed to be a high-speed target drone belonging to the Indian Air Force, has revealed that the drone was not operated within Sri Lankan airspace, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: 12 bus drivers penalised for hazardous accessories
byline: Hatton Police have initiated legal action against 12 bus drivers for operating vehicles fitted with unauthorised accessories that posed risks to passengers and the public.

title: PS member granted bail over defamation of MP Kottahachchi
byline: The former Millaniya Pradeshiya Sabha (PS) member, Ravindra Nawamuni, who was arrested for sharing a post on social media insulting NPP MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi, has been granted by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Over 6,000 dog, cat bite victims sought treatment from Badulla Hospital
byline: Around 42,000 patients had obtained emergency treatment at the Badulla Teaching Hospital and 6,700 of them were victims of cat and dog bite victims, an official said today.

title: Sri Lanka achieves record tax revenue in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka recorded its highest-ever tax revenue in history, collecting a total of Rs. 1.95 trillion in 2024, the Inland Revenue Department (IRD) announced today.

title: Probe launched after girl hospitalised drinking chemical mistakenly served as soft drink
byline: Police and the Colombo Municipal Council’s Medical Officer have launched an investigation after a 19-year-old girl was hospitalised after ingesting a cleaning chemical served in a soft drink bottle at a restaurant in People’s Park, Pettah.
